title: Problem 2129_B
statement: You are given a permutation p_1, p_2, ..., p_n of length n.You have to build an array a_1, a_2, ..., a_n in the following way: for each 1 ≤q i ≤q n, set either a_i = p_i or a_i = 2n - p_i. Find the minimum possible number of inversions in the array a_1, a_2, ..., a_n.A permutation of length n is an array consisting of n distinct integers from 1 to n in arbitrary order.
